hint.text: Represent the square number as a product of its prime factors

solution.text:
\(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**o)}}_\)
\(=_{j}_^_{m}_ \times _{k}_^_{n}_ _{{('\\times'+ str(l)+'^'+str(o)) if (o>0) else ''}}_\)
Therefore, the number of distinct prime factors are \(_{{3 if (o>0) else 2}}_\)

content.text: How many distinct prime factors exist for the square number \(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**o)}}_\)?
